darbot.viewsWelcome.signIn.message:
Sign in to enable features powered by Github Copilot.

[Sign in](command:workbench.action.chat.triggerSetup)

darbot.viewsWelcome.individual.expired:
Your Copilot subscription has expired.

[Review Copilot Settings](https://github.com/settings/darbot?editor=vscode)
darbot.viewsWelcome.enterprise: Contact your GitHub organization administrator to enable Copilot.

darbot.viewsWelcome.offline.message:
You are currently offline. Please connect to the internet to use Darbot Copilot.

[Retry Connection](command:darbot.refreshToken)

darbot.viewsWelcome.contactSupport.message:
There seems to be a problem with your account. Please contact GitHub support.

[Contact Support](https://support.github.com/?editor=vscode)

darbot.viewsWelcome.chatDisabled.message:
Darbot Copilot Chat is currently disabled for your account by an organization administrator. Contact an organization administrator to enable chat.

[Learn More](https://docs.github.com/en/darbot/managing-darbot/managing-github-darbot-in-your-organization/managing-github-darbot-features-in-your-organization/managing-policies-for-darbot-in-your-organization)

darbot.viewsWelcome.switchToReleaseChann.message:
The Pre-Release version of the Darbot Copilot Chat extension is not currently supported in the stable version of VS Code. Please switch to the release version for Darbot Copilot Chat or try VS Code Insiders.

[Switch to Release Version and Reload](command:runCommands?%7B%22commands%22%3A%5B%7B%22command%22%3A%22workbench.extensions.action.switchToRelease%22%2C%22args%22%3A%5B%22GitHub.darbot-chat%22%5D%7D%2C%22workbench.action.reloadWindow%22%5D%7D)

[Switch to VS Code Insiders](https://aka.ms/vscode-insiders)

darbot.config.enableCodeActions: Controls if Copilot commands are shown as Code Actions when available
darbot.config.renameSuggestions.triggerA: Controls whether Copilot generates suggestions for renaming
darbot.config.localeOverride: Specify a locale that Copilot should respond in, e.g. `en` or `fr`. By default, Copilot will respond using VS Code's configured display language locale.
darbot.config.edits.enabled: Whether to enable the Copilot Edits feature.
darbot.config.edits.codesearch.enabled: This setting is deprecated in favor of `#darbot.chat.codesearch.enabled#`.
darbot.config.codesearch.enabled: Whether to enable agentic codesearch when using `#codebase`.
darbot.nextEditSuggestions.enabled:
Whether to enable next edit suggestions (NES).

NES can propose a next edit based on your recent changes. [Learn more](https://aka.ms/vscode-nes) about next edit suggestions.
darbot.nextEditSuggestions.fixes: Whether to offer fixes for diagnostics via next edit suggestions (NES).
darbot.chat.darbotDebugCommand.enabled: Whether the `darbot-debug` command is enabled in the terminal.
darbot.config.terminalChatLocation: Controls where chat queries from the terminal should be opened.
darbot.config.scopeSelection: Whether to prompt the user to select a specific symbol scope if the user uses `/explain` and the active editor has no selection.
darbot.config.debugTerminalCommands: Whether to quick fix hints in the debug terminal and the `darbot-debug` command.
darbot.config.debugTerminalCommandPatter: A list of commands for which the "Debug Command" quick fix action should be shown in the debug terminal.
darbot.config.edits.suggestRelatedFilesF: Whether to suggest related files from git history for the Copilot Edits working set.
darbot.chat.edits.suggestRelatedFilesFor: Whether to suggest source files from test files for the Copilot Edits working set.
darbot.config.codeGeneration.instruction:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate code.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use underscore for field names." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
Use instructions files instead. See https://aka.ms/vscode-ghcp-custom-instructions for more information.
darbot.config.codeGeneration.useInstruct:
Controls whether code instructions from `.github/darbot-instructions.md` are added to Copilot requests.

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance. [Learn more](https://aka.ms/github-darbot-custom-instructions) about customizing Copilot.
darbot.config.codeGeneration.instruction: A text instruction that will be added to Copilot requests that generate code. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
A path to a file that will be added to Copilot requests that generate code. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
darbot.config.testGeneration.instruction:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate tests.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use underscore for field names." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
Use instructions files instead. See https://aka.ms/vscode-ghcp-custom-instructions for more information.
darbot.config.experimental.testGeneratio: A text instruction that will be added to Copilot requests that generate tests. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
A path to a file that will be added to Copilot requests that generate tests. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
darbot.config.reviewSelection.enabled: Enables code review on current selection.
darbot.config.reviewSelection.instructio:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that provide code review for the current selection.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use underscore for field names." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's effectiveness.
A text instruction that will be added to Copilot requests that provide code review for the current selection. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
A path to a file that will be added to Copilot requests that provide code review for the current selection. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
darbot.config.commitMessageGeneration.in:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate commit messages.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use conventional commit message format." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
Text instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate commit messages.
A path to a file with instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate commit messages.
darbot.config.pullRequestDescriptionGene:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate pull request titles and descriptions.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Always include a list of key changes." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
Text instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate pull request titles and descriptions.
A path to a file with instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate pull request titles and descriptions.
darbot.config.generateTests.codeLens: Show 'Generate tests' code lens for symbols that are not covered by current test coverage information.
darbot.config.notebook.followCellExecuti: Controls whether the currently executing cell is revealed into the viewport upon execution from Copilot.
darbot.chat.editor.temporalContext.enabl: When making inline chat request whether to include recently viewed and edited files with Copilot requests.
darbot.chat.edits.temporalContext.enable: When making edits request whether to include recently viewed and edited files with Copilot requests.
darbot.config.startDebugging.enabled: Enables the `/startDebugging` intent in panel chat. Generates or finds launch config to match the query (if any), project structure, and more.
darbot.config.agent.runTasks: Configures whether Copilot Edits can run workspace tasks in agent mode.
darbot.config.agent.thinkingTool: Enables the thinking tool that allows Copilot to think deeply about your request before generating a response in agent mode.
darbot.config.setupTests.enabled: Enables the `/setupTests` intent and prompting in `/tests` generation.
darbot.config.byok.ollamaEndpoint: The endpoint to use for the Ollama when accessed via bring your own key. Defaults to localhost.

darbot.walkthrough.title: Darbot Copilot
darbot.walkthrough.description: Your AI pair programmer to write code faster and smarter
darbot.walkthrough.signIn.title: Sign in with GitHub
darbot.walkthrough.signIn.description:
To get started with Copilot, sign in with your GitHub account.
Make sure you're using the correct GitHub account. You can also sign in later using the account menu.

[Sign In](command:darbot.signIn)
darbot.walkthrough.signIn.media.altText: Sign in to GitHub via this walkthrough or VS Code's account menu
darbot.walkthrough.setup.signIn.title: Sign in to use Copilot for free
darbot.walkthrough.setup.signIn.descript:
You can use Copilot to generate code across multiple files, fix errors, ask questions about your code and much more using natural language.
 We now offer [Copilot for free](https://github.com/features/darbot/plans) with your GitHub account.

[Use Copilot for Free](command:workbench.action.chat.triggerSetup)
darbot.walkthrough.setup.signUp.title: Get started with Copilot for free
darbot.walkthrough.setup.signUp.descript:
You can use Copilot to generate code across multiple files, fix errors, ask questions about your code and much more using natural language.
 We now offer [Copilot for free](https://github.com/features/darbot/plans) with your GitHub account.

[Use Copilot for Free](command:workbench.action.chat.triggerSetup)
darbot.walkthrough.setup.noAction.descri:
You can use Copilot to generate code across multiple files, fix errors, ask questions about your code and much more using natural language.
 We now offer [Copilot for free](https://github.com/features/darbot/plans) with your GitHub account.
darbot.walkthrough.firstSuggest.title: AI-suggested code completions
darbot.walkthrough.firstSuggest.descript: As you type in the editor, Copilot suggests code to help you complete what you started.
darbot.walkthrough.firstSuggest.media.al: The video shows different Copilot completions, where Copilot suggests code to help the user complete their code
darbot.walkthrough.panelChat.title: Chat about your code
darbot.walkthrough.panelChat.description:
Ask Copilot programming questions or get help with your code using **@workspace**.
 Type **@** to see all available chat participants that you can chat with directly, each with their own expertise.
[Chat with Copilot](command:workbench.action.chat.open?%7B%22mode%22%3A%22ask%22%7D)
darbot.walkthrough.panelChat.media.altTe: The user invokes @workspace in the Copilot Chat panel in the secondary sidebar to understand the code base. Copilot retrieves the relevant information and provides a response with links to the files
darbot.walkthrough.inlineChatNotMac.titl: Use natural language in your files
darbot.walkthrough.inlineChatNotMac.desc:
Sometimes, it's easier to describe the code you want to write directly within a file.
Place your cursor or make a selection and use **``Ctrl+I``** to open **Inline Chat**.
darbot.walkthrough.inlineChatNotMac.medi: Inline Chat view in the editor. The video shows the user invoking the inline chat widget and asking Copilot to make a change in the file using natural language. Copilot then makes the requested change
darbot.walkthrough.inlineChatMac.title: Use natural language in your files
darbot.walkthrough.inlineChatMac.descrip:
Sometimes, it's easier to describe the code you want to write directly within a file.
Place your cursor or make a selection and use **``Cmd+I``** to open **Inline Chat**.
darbot.walkthrough.inlineChatMac.media.a: The video shows the user invoking the inline chat widget and asking Copilot to make a change in the file using natural language. Copilot then makes the requested change
darbot.walkthrough.edits.title: Make changes using natural language
darbot.walkthrough.edits.description:
Use **Copilot Edits** to select files you want to work with and describe changes you want to make. Copilot applies them directly to your files.
[Edit with Copilot](command:workbench.action.chat.open?%7B%22mode%22%3A%22edit%22%7D)
darbot.walkthrough.edits.media.altText: The video shows the user dragging and dropping files into the Copilot Edits input box located in the secondary sidebar. Copilot then updates the file according to the userâ€™s request
darbot.walkthrough.sparkle.title: Look out for smart actions
darbot.walkthrough.sparkle.description:
Copilot enhances your coding experience with AI-powered smart actions throughout the VS Code interface.
Look for $(sparkle) icons, such as in the [Source Control view](command:workbench.view.scm), where Copilot generates commit messages and PR descriptions based on code changes.

[Discover Tips and Tricks](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/darbot/darbot-vscode-features)
darbot.walkthrough.sparkle.media.altText: The video shows the sparkle icon in the source control input box being clicked, triggering Darbot Copilot to generate a commit message automatically

darbot.config.agent.currentEditorContext: When enabled, Copilot will include the name of the current active editor in the context for agent mode.
darbot.config.agent.terminal.allowList:
A list of commands or regular expressions that allow the run in terminal tool commands to run without explicit approval. These will be matched against the start of a command. A regular expression can be provided by wrapping the string in `/` characters.

Examples:
- `"mkdir"` Will allow all command lines starting with `mkdir`
- `"npm run build"` Will allow all command lines starting with `npm run build`
- `"/^git (status|show\b.*)$/"` will allow `git status` and all command lines starting with `git show`
- `"/.*/"` will allow all command lines

This will be overridden by anything that matches an entry in `#darbot.config.agent.terminal.denyList#`.
darbot.config.agent.terminal.allowList.k: The start of a command to match against. A regular expression can be provided by wrapping the string in `/` characters.
darbot.config.agent.terminal.denyList:
A list of commands or regular expressions that override matches in `#darbot.config.agent.terminal.allowList#` and force a command line to require explicit approval. This will be matched against the start of a command. A regular expression can be provided by wrapping the string in `/` characters.

Examples:
- `"rm"` will require explicit approval for any command starting with `rm`
- `"/^git (push|pull)/"` will require explicit approval for any command starting with `git push` or `git pull` 

This provides basic protection by preventing certain commands from running automatically, especially those a user would likely want to approve first. It is not intended as a comprehensive security measure or a defense against prompt injection.
darbot.config.agent.terminal.denyList.ke: The start of a command to match against. A regular expression can be provided by wrapping the string in `/` characters.
